para: GeographicQ2T is a , used as the split_how parameter in when splitting quadrilateral &elems; into triangles.

A quadrilateral has a four neighboring &elems;. If it has two neighbors of one type (defined by their dominant pixel category) and two of another, arranged as in (a), and if the &elem; itself is inhomogeneous, then there's a good chance that dividing it along the diagonal shown in (b) will improve the homogeneity of the &skel;.

para: GeographicQ2T can be fast because it only examines quads with a high likelyhood of being splittable. However, it can skip over splittable quads if the &skel; is not already sufficiently refined and one of the neighbors has the wrong type. is slower but more thorough.
